sen.j: 橘 俊綱（たちばな の としつな、長元元年（1028年） - 寛治8年7月14日 (旧暦)（1094年8月27日））は、平安時代後期の官人・歌人。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Toshitsuna (1028 - August 27, 1094) was a government official (esp. one of low to medium rank) and poet of the late Heian Period.
TACHIBANA no Toshitsuna (1028 - August 27, 1094) was a government official and poet during the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: of→during; changed "period" to lowercase for consistency with other articles; eliminated "(esp. one of low to medium rank)" as it was awkward, seemed unecessary and is not consistent with other articles
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Toshitsuna (1028 - September 2, 1094) was a government official and poet during the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: August 27 をSeptember 2 に修正しました。

sen.e: He was an adopted son of Toshitsuna TACHIBANA, Sanuki no kami (the governor of Sanuki Province).

sen.e: He was an adopted son of Toshitsuna TACHIBANA who was the Sanuki no kami (governor of Sanuki Province).

sen.j: 『今鏡』において、弟の藤原師実が伏見の別邸を突然訪ねるも俊綱が豪奢にもてなした話や、俊綱が白河天皇に対して、院が造営した鳥羽離宮より伏見の別邸の方が優れていると問答をしたとの話が語られている。
sen.e: Imakagami (the Mirror of the Present) describes that Toshitsuna lavished hospitality to his brother, FUJIWARA no Morosanehe, in his visit to the residence in Fushimi and that Toshitsuna was asked and responded Emperor Shirakaw that his residence was gracious than Toba Rikyu (Toba Imperial Villa) built for the retired emperor.

In Imakagami (The Mirror of the Present), it is described how Toshitsuna lavishly showed hospitality to his brother FUJIWARA no Morosanehe during a visit to his residence in Fushimi, and in response to Emperor Shirakawa, there was discussion regarding whether or not Toshitsune's residence was more gracious than the Toba Rikyu (Toba Imperial Villa) built for the retired emperor.

sen.j: 『宇治拾遺物語』には、俊綱は昔尾張国の「俊綱」（すんごう）と言う僧侶であった時、熱田神宮の大宮司に侮辱を受けたが、のちに関白の息子として生まれ変わり尾張守となって、今度は熱田神宮の大宮司にかつての雪辱をした、との説話がある。
sen.e: According to "Uji Shui Monogatari" (a collection of the Tales from Uji), Toshitsuna was insulted by the chief priest of Ise-jingu Shrinewhen when he was a priest of Owari Province, but he was reborn to be a son of Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) and revenged the chief priest of Ise-jingu Shrine.

According to "Uji Shui Monogatari" (a collection of the Tales from Uji), Toshitsuna was insulted by the chief priest of Ise-jingu Shrine while Toshitsuna was a priest of Owari Province, but he was reborn as a son of the Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) and had revenge against the chief priest of Ise-jingu Shrine.
